overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Natural Language.

First, install @google-cloud/language with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/language

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/languageâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var language = require('@google-cloud/language')();

Elsewhere

var language = require('@google-cloud/language')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/language are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: LanguageServiceClient
methods.description: Provides text analysis operations such as sentiment analysis and entity recognition.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: callback
params.description: • the callback to be called with the current project Id.

methods.name: analyzeSentiment
methods.description: Analyzes the sentiment of the provided text.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: request.encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate sentence offsets for the sentence sentiment.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing AnalyzeSentimentResponse AnalyzeSentimentResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing AnalyzeSentimentResponse AnalyzeSentimentResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: analyzeEntities
methods.description: Finds named entities (currently proper names and common nouns) in the text along with entity types, salience, mentions for each entity, and other properties.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: request.encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing AnalyzeEntitiesResponse AnalyzeEntitiesResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing AnalyzeEntitiesResponse AnalyzeEntitiesResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: analyzeEntitySentiment
methods.description: Finds entities, similar to {@link AnalyzeEntities} in the text and analyzes sentiment associated with each entity and its mentions.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: request.encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing AnalyzeEntitySentimentResponse AnalyzeEntitySentimentResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing AnalyzeEntitySentimentResponse AnalyzeEntitySentimentResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: analyzeSyntax
methods.description: Analyzes the syntax of the text and provides sentence boundaries and tokenization along with part of speech tags, dependency trees, and other properties.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: request.encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing AnalyzeSyntaxResponse AnalyzeSyntaxResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing AnalyzeSyntaxResponse AnalyzeSyntaxResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: annotateText
methods.description: A convenience method that provides all syntax, sentiment, and entity features in one call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: request.features
params.description:
The enabled features.

This object should have the same structure as Features Features

params.name: request.encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing AnnotateTextResponse AnnotateTextResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing AnnotateTextResponse AnnotateTextResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
